column4: hi, i'm running ubuntu 7.10. i have an external firewire hd and when I plug it in it isn't recognized by the system at all... it does power up, but does not auto mount
the system may be recognizing it, but i'm not sure how to check for this sort of thing... have been doing research but nothing is helping out too much
see if anything new appears in /dev
unplug it and do ls /dev/*d*
then plug it back in and do ls /dev/*d* again
see if anynithing new appeared
yes list changed after plugging it in
u are looking for something like sda or sdb or something like that
any idea why it won't auto mount?
dunno because it doesnt know where to mount
found  sdb
whats its name in /dev?
any partitions on it ie sdb1 sdb2 or such?
/dev/sdb... before and after plugging in there were sda1, sda2 and sda5
looks like its unformatted is it a new drive?
can linux not read a mac formatted drive?
nope should recognize it
in any case try sudo /dev/sdb /mnt
err sudo mount /dev/sdb /mnt
will do
and see if it mounts
just mounted :)
(had to answer phone)... so i'm assuming i'll have to do this every time I want to use it?
